intro: Boechera repanda, commonly known as the broadleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are basal and broad, with a distinctive waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. Boechera repanda produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring.
